data.event: Salem was first settled in 1761 by Joshua Conkey and James Turner who as soldiers in the French and Indian War, passed through the territory.
In 1764, Alexander and James Turner acquired a patent which was soon divided up between the New Englanders from Pelham Mass.

event.title: used Salem as its base in 1776

data.event: The Charlotte County and White Creek militia used Salem as its base in 1776.

event.title: was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 2010
